title: Understanding Scientific Notation
text: Scientific notation is a way to express very large or small numbers. It is written as a number between $$1$$ and $$10$$ followed by a power of $$10$$.

title: Identifying the First Component
text: Find a number between $$1$$ and $$10$$ by moving the decimal point of the original number, 24,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 $$m$$, to the left.

title: Finding the Coefficient
text: What is the number that results from 24,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 after moving the decimal point just after the first non-zero digit?

title: Counting Decimal Places
text: Since you moved the decimal point, count how many places it moved from its original position to its new position.

title: Determining the Exponent
text: What is the exponent of $$10$$ when you move the decimal point from the end of 24,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 to just after the 2?

title: Writing the Final Answer
text: Combine the number from step $$3$$ (coefficient) and step $$5$$ (exponent) to form the scientific notation: coefficient times $$10$$ raised to the exponent.
